snippet: Pro-government forces in the capital opened fire on Tuesday at thousands of demonstrators from the Shiite religious minority, killing six and injuring dozens, officials and witnesses said.
abstract: Yemeni pro-government forces in Sana open fire at thousands of demonstrators from Shiite religious minority, killing six and injuring dozens of others; protesters, who support rebel group Houthi, are demanding that the government reverse its decision to slash subsidies and then step down.

byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Pro-government forces in the capital opened fire on Tuesday at thousands of demonstrators from the Shiite religious minority, killing six and injuring dozens, officials and witnesses said.

headline.main: Violence Erupts in Yemen Capital After Weeks of Rallies
headline.print_headline: Violence Erupts in Yemen Capital After Weeks of Rallies
